title: Time to designate space systems as critical infrastructure
summary: Frank J. Cilluffo is director of the McCrary Institute for Cyber and Critical Infrastructure Security at Auburn University. He also served as a commissioner on the U.S. Cyberspace Solarium Commission. […]

title: SpaceLogistics to service Intelsat satellite after Optus life-extending mission
summary: Intelsat has ordered one of three fuel pods Northrop Grumman’s in-orbit servicing subsidiary is launching in late 2024 to extend the life of one of its geostationary satellites by at least six years, the operator announced April 13.

title: In Navy experiment, commercial satellites serve as key weapons against drug traffickers
summary: In an experiment last fall near Virginia's coast, a team of engineers used commercial hardware, software and satellite data to show the U.S. Navy how it could quickly turn information from satellites into useful intelligence.

title: First ispace mission ready for lunar landing as company stock starts trading
summary: As Japanese company ispace prepares to land on the moon for the first time, its stock is taking off on a Japanese exchange.

title: Rocket Report: SpaceX may lease High Bay 1 in the VAB; China to fight price war
summary: "It is the only company that could see material cost savings by fully acquiring ULA."

title: SpaceX Transporter-7 scrubs launch of 51 payloads, booster return to LZ
summary: SpaceX scrubbed a scheduled launch of the Transporter-7 rideshare mission from Space Launch Complex 4E (SLC-4E) at Vandenberg Space Force Base due to weather constraints. The mission will try again on Friday, April 14, 2023, at 11:47 PM PDT (06:47 UTC on April 15).

title: NASA's Ingenuity Mars Helicopter Completes 50th Flight
summary: The history-making rotorcraft has recently been negotiating some of the most hazardous terrain it’s encountered on the Red Planet.

title: NRO awards contract extensions to Hawkeye 360 and Maxar’s Aurora Insight for radio-frequency data
summary: HawkEye 360 and Maxar Technologies have been awarded contract extensions by the National Reconnaissance Office for commercial radio-frequency (RF) data.

title: Saltzman: Space Force has to better define relationship with commercial industry
summary: As space technology continues to advance at a rapid pace, the role of commercial industry in national defense has become a hot topic, the chief of space operations of the U.S. Space Force Gen. B. Chance Saltzman said April 13.

title: South Korea’s KSLV-2 rocket set to launch May 24
summary: South Korea’s homegrown KSLV-2 rocket is slated to launch May 24, carrying a 180-kilogram technology demonstration satellite and seven cubesats.
